posts.content: Who's stoked? You guys have plans for a project in November? :D
I'm so excited!!! I swear I've waited all year for November to finally arrive. This'll be my second NaNo so loads of ideas to play around with :D How about you?
I was one of the winners last year, but will not be participating this year.

I wrote a whole book after I face-planted NaNo last year, so this year I'm writing 50k of the sequel. :D Super stoked. I've already kind of started working on it, but I feel like as long as I do 50k words in November (even if it's not necessarily start to finish) it still counts. Probably. If it doesn't technically count, I'm still issuing it as a personal challenge anyway.

I am looking forward to it, is nice to have something to help me focus on really getting some writing done. I don't think I will ever manage to get 50,000 words done in a month but its good to see just how much i can manage to do.

I think NaNo is all about personal challenges. So it counts in my books :D I do all my planning before hand. Outlining each chapter etc. So the novel is almost written before NaNo but I still think it counts ;) As long as we try to write something then I think we fulfill our NaNo obligations. :)

Yeah, that's the whole point of NaNo: to challenge yourself and get a lot done! My boyfriend is a Dungeons & Dragons buff so for NaNo he's trying to create a whole fantasy campaign. So, to each their own, I suppose! :D

And yeah Frogscookie, last year I only got 15k written. But I'd never written more words in a single work in my life, and I'm happy I hit that milestone, even if it wasn't 50k!

I'm really looking forward for NaNoWriMo! I've been waiting all year for November to arrive! It'll be my fifth participation this year and I still get butterflies in my stomach whenever the first of November creeps closer! <3

Aaah that's awesome Bianka! I love hearing how exited people get. It sort of restores my faith in humanity a little bit. That writing a strenuous amount can instill that sort of happiness in a person is awesome!
I'm Doing it as well, and a Zombie survival story to boot. Know my character, setting and set up, can't wait until November comes and I can find out the rest.

NANO, NANO. NANO! Sorry for hitting the caps lock, I am just getting all hyped up! I plan on winning this year too! After not managing to write 50 K words in 2010/2011, I booked a week off work and will do nothing but write lols.

Nice to see some fellow Wrimos on here too!

This will be my second nano and I feel like I've been waiting around all year for November so I can word vomit all over again. I'm excited. Not sure if I am doing a sequel to last years novel or something entirely new. Hmmmm...

4th year, and I'm super excited! I almost made it to the 50k first year but tragedy struck as my work went missing :(. The following 2 years had been busy and hard to complete. But this year I have 2 projects! So I am pushing hard for it this year and am currently practicing with trying to fit as many words as possible into my days so that I know how much work I can get done! Also took the 1st off work so that I can focus on writing all day.
High five for people taking time off work to write :D I would but it's my first yr of uni... Good luck everyone XD

So fellow nanowrimos, WHO IS GOING TO BACK UP THEIR WORK AFTER EVERY SESSION?

Say blue moon cheese, mega elephant shorts if you are! :P

After losing three novel loads of chapters, I know I will be!

XD
Forgot to mention, I might be working on a sequel to my first novel Mage Light or doing another fantasy book lols? So what genre is everyone doing this year?

I am doing science fiction for this year's NaNo -- alternate history, to be precise. It is a prequel to the NaNo that I wrote last year. This time it is set some 50 years earlier in early 1900s Paris. The elderly mother-in-law of the protagonist in the first novel is going to be the young (early 20s) protagonist of this novel.

I'm sticking with SF again, writing a direct sequel to my last work. I'm still so in love with post apocalyptic settings, I can't let this series go. :) I even found a way to link a third book to the series, since I have this next one all plotted and planned out. One book at a time, Maranda... lol Man I wish I could take time off work to do this! I'm really going to have to crack down to get 50k words...

This is my second nano - I won last year - it was a challenge and I actually cried when I verified my word count - it was a huge accomplishment for me...... and BLUE CHEESE MOON, MEGA ELEPHANT SHORTS ;)

I'm doing a fantasy romance drama....... it'll be a serious romance rather than a happy happy romance...... good luck everyone!!
Aaaaaah I'm too scared to write a romance. I have no idea why. One of these days I'll sum up the courage to, lol.
